us.ihmc.euclid.geometry

Class LineSegment1D

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.ihmc.euclid.geometry.LineSegment1D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Clearable, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.EpsilonComparable<LineSegment1D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometricallyComparable<LineSegment1D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Settable<LineSegment1D>

    public class LineSegment1D
extends java.lang.Object
implements us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Clearable, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Settable<LineSegment1D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.EpsilonComparable<LineSegment1D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometricallyComparable<LineSegment1D>
    Represents a finite-length 1D line segment defined by its two 1D endpoints.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LineSegment1D()
      Default constructor that initializes both endpoints of this line segment to Double.NaN.

      Initializes this line segment to have the given endpoints.

      Initializes this line segment to have the given endpoints.
      LineSegment1D(LineSegment1D other)
      Creates a new line segment 1D and initializes it to other.

    • Method Detail

      • computeOverlap

        public boolean computeOverlap(LineSegment1D other,
                              LineSegment1D intersectionToPack)
        Computes the overlap between this line segment and the other line segment and stores the result in intersectionToPack.

        Edge cases:

        • If the two line segments do not overlap, this method fails, returns false and intersecitonToPack remains unchanged.

        Parameters:
        other - the other line segment. Not modified.
        intersectionToPack - line segment used to store the result. Modified.
        Returns:
        whether the two line segment overlap or no.

      • computeOverlap

        public LineSegment1D computeOverlap(LineSegment1D other)
        Computes the overlap between this line segment and the other line segment and stores the result in intersectionToPack.

        Edge cases:

        • If the two line segments do not overlap, this method fails, returns false and intersecitonToPack remains unchanged.

        WARNING: This method generates garbage.

        Parameters:
        other - the other line segment. Not modified.
        Returns:
        the line segment representing the overlap, or null if the line segments do not overlap.

      • isOverlappingInclusive

        public boolean isOverlappingInclusive(LineSegment1D other)
        Tests if this line segment and the other overlap or not.

        Edge cases:

        • If the two line segments only share one of their endpoint, they are considered to be overlapping.

        Parameters:
        other - the query. Not modified.
        Returns:
        true if the two line segments overlap, false otherwise.

      • isOverlappingExclusive

        public boolean isOverlappingExclusive(LineSegment1D other)
        Tests if this line segment and the other overlap or not.

        Edge cases:

        • If the two line segments only share one of their endpoint, they do not overlap.

        Parameters:
        other - the query. Not modified.
        Returns:
        true if the two line segments overlap, false otherwise.

      • isBetweenEndpointsInclusive

        public boolean isBetweenEndpointsInclusive(LineSegment1D other)
        Tests if this line segment entirely contains the given line segment other.

        Edge cases:

        • If the two line segments have one or two endpoints in common, this line segment entirely contains other.

        Parameters:
        other - the query. Not modified.
        Returns:
        true if this line segment contains other, false otherwise.

      • isBetweenEndpointsExclusive

        public boolean isBetweenEndpointsExclusive(LineSegment1D other)
        Tests if this line segment entirely contains the given line segment other.

        Edge cases:

        • If the two line segments have one or two endpoints in common, this line segment does not contain other.

        Parameters:
        other - the query. Not modified.
        Returns:
        true if this line segment contains other, false otherwise.

      • isBetweenEndpointsInclusive

        public boolean isBetweenEndpointsInclusive(double point)
        Tests if this line segment contains the given point.

        Edge cases:

        • If the given point is equal to one of this line segment's endpoints, the point is considered to be between this line segment endpoints.

        Parameters:
        point - the query.
        Returns:
        true if this line segment contains point, false otherwise.

      • isBetweenEndpointsExclusive

        public boolean isBetweenEndpointsExclusive(double point)
        Tests if this line segment contains the given point.

        Edge cases:

        • If the given point is equal to one of this line segment's endpoints, the point is considered to be outside this line segment.

        Parameters:
        point - the query.
        Returns:
        true if this line segment contains point, false otherwise.

      • isBetweenEndpoints

        public boolean isBetweenEndpoints(double point,
                                  double epsilon)
        Tests whether the given point is located between the two endpoints with a given conservative tolerance epsilon:

      • if epsilon > 0, the point has to be between the endpoints and at a minimum distance of epsilon * this.length() from the closest endpoint.
      • if epsilon < 0, the point has to be between the endpoints or at a maximum distance of -epsilon * this.length() from the closest endpoint.
      • if epsilon = 0, the point has to be between the endpoints or equal to one of the endpoints.

Parameters:
point - the query.
epsilon - the tolerance to use for this test. If positive, the test becomes less restrictive. If negative, the test becomes more conservative.
Returns:
true if the point is considered to be between this line segment's endpoints, false otherwise.

  • signedDistance

    public double signedDistance(double point)
    Calculates the distance between the query and the closest endpoint.

    If the point is located between the endpoints of this line segment, the returned value of the distance is negative.

    Parameters:
    point - the query.
    Returns:
    the distance between the query and this line segment.

  • distance

    public double distance(double point)
    Calculates the distance between the query and the closest endpoint.

    If the point is located between the endpoints of this line segment, this method returns 0.

    Parameters:
    point - the query.
    Returns:
    the distance between the query and this line segment.

  • extendSegmentToPoint

    public void extendSegmentToPoint(double point)
    Extends this line segment to include the given point.

    If the point is between this line segment's endpoints, this line segment remains unchanged.

    Parameters:
    point - the point to be included by extended this line segment.

  • isBefore

    public boolean isBefore(double point)
    Tests if the given point is located outside this line segment and that this line segment is point away from the point.
    Parameters:
    point - the query.
    Returns:
    true if the point is located before this line segment, false if the point is located between the endpoints of this line segment or if this line segment is pointed toward the point.

  • isAfter

    public boolean isAfter(double point)
    Tests if the given point is located outside this line segment and that this line segment is point toward the point.
    Parameters:
    point - the query.
    Returns:
    true if the point is located after this line segment, false if the point is located between the endpoints of this line segment or if this line segment is pointed away from the point.

  • setMinPoint

    public void setMinPoint(double newMinPoint)
    Updates the endpoint of this line segment with the lowest coordinate.
    Parameters:
    newMinPoint - the new coordinate for the endpoint with the lowest coordinate.
    Throws:
    java.lang.RuntimeException - if the argument is greater or equal to the endpoint with greatest coordinate. This prevents to flip this line segment's direction.

  • setMaxPoint

    public void setMaxPoint(double newMaxPoint)
    Updates the endpoint of this line segment with the highest coordinate.
    Parameters:
    newMaxPoint - the new coordinate for the endpoint with the highest coordinate.
    Throws:
    java.lang.RuntimeException - if the argument is less or equal to the endpoint with lowest coordinate. This prevents to flip this line segment's direction.

  • toLineSegment3d

    public LineSegment3D toLineSegment3d(Line3DReadOnly line3d)
    Compute the 3D equivalent of this line segment. The 3D equivalent of each end point is computed as follows: endPoint3d = endPoint1d * lineDirection3d + lineStart3d.
    Parameters:
    line3d - the 3D line used as reference to compute the 3D line segment.
    Returns:
    the 3D equivalent of this line segment.

  • toLineSegment3d

    public LineSegment3D toLineSegment3d(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DReadOnly zero3d,
                                     us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Vector3DReadOnly direction3d)
    Compute the 3D equivalent of this line segment. The 3D equivalent of each end point is computed as follows: endPoint3d = endPoint1d * direction3d + zero3d.
    Parameters:
    zero3d - position of the 3D equivalent of an endpoint equal to zero.
    direction3d - direction toward greater values of endPoint1d.
    Returns:
    the 3D equivalent of this line segment.

  • toLineSegment2d

    public LineSegment2D toLineSegment2d(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly zero2d,
                                     us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Vector2DReadOnly direction2d)
    Compute the 2D equivalent of this line segment. The 2D equivalent of each end point is computed as follows: endPoint2d = endPoint1d * direction2d + zero2d.
    Parameters:
    zero2d - position of the 2D equivalent of an endpoint equal to zero.
    direction2d - direction toward greater values of endPoint1d.
    Returns:
    the 2D equivalent of this line segment.

  • epsilonEquals

    public boolean epsilonEquals(LineSegment1D other,
                             double epsilon)
    Tests on a per-component basis on both endpoints if this line segment is equal to other with the tolerance epsilon.
    Specified by:
    epsilonEquals in interface us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.EpsilonComparable<LineSegment1D>
    Parameters:
    other - the query. Not modified.
    epsilon - the tolerance to use.
    Returns:
    true if the two line segments are equal, false otherwise.

  • geometricallyEquals

    public boolean geometricallyEquals(LineSegment1D other,
                                   double epsilon)
    Compares this to other to determine if the two line segments are geometrically similar.

    The comparison is based on comparing the line segments' endpoints. Two line segments are considered geometrically equal even if they are defined with opposite direction.

    Specified by:
    geometricallyEquals in interface us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometricallyComparable<LineSegment1D>
    Parameters:
    other - the line segment to compare to. Not modified.
    epsilon - the tolerance of the comparison.
    Returns:
    true if the two line segments represent the same geometry, false otherwise.

    Parameters:

    Returns:
    true if the two line segments are exactly equal component-wise, false otherwise.
